Posts.Title: Postcard from the edge of ten years out.... weesa lifelover

Posts.Content: Sep 28, 2011 09:30PM KiwiMum wrote: I had mild psoriasis before having chemo. I've nearly finished a long course of chemo and my psoriasis is a hundred times worse. I also got sent to a dermatologist. My onc tells me that when you have an existing skin condition, some patients have it go away completely on chemo, some have it get far far worse. We are those people! On top of everything else, it sucks!!
Posts.Title: Face Rash-- Really?! weerah weerah

Posts.Content: KiwiMum wrote: 3 years ago, not long after my 40th birthday, I found a lump.  In what now appears a very common story, my doctor said "you're too young", "you're not in the risk group" etc etc. Turns out she was wrong. She did the right thing and got me checked out.  A few whirlwind days later I found out that Yes, it was indeed BC.  They knew there was one lump, after my mastectomy it was revealed that there were 4.  They knew nodes were involved ... I certainly wasn't expecting 12. Here I am 3 years on and doing great.  My hair is below my shoulders, my recon was completed last year and all in all life is good. I no longer think about BC every day.  I have 6 monthly appointments with the surgeon and oncologist.  When I asked my onc last  week at what stage he would say he no longer has to see me, he looked at my file and replied "you and I are going to grow old together".  We that's a bummer that I never get cut loose, but how fantastic to think I'm going to grow old! I no longer frequent this site daily/hourly like I used to but I wanted to drop in and share my story and hopefully give others hope.  Especially those who are scared and newly diagnosed.   I'm definitely planning on adding my name to the 5 year list! Bring it on! Dx 3/2/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 2, 12/24 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 3/14/2011 Lymph node removal: Right; Mastectomy: Right Chemotherapy 4/19/2011 AC + T (Taxol) Radiation Therapy 10/25/2011 Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 11/1/2011 Surgery 2/1/2013 Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap Surgery 7/1/2013 Reconstruction (right): Nipple reconstruction Hormonal Therapy 10/17/2014 Aromasin (exemestane) Surgery Prophylactic ovary removal Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2011 01:59PM KiwiMum wrote: RoBo - my eyebrows all fell out about 2 wks PFC. I'd recommend just using brow powder in the short term as mine grew back really quickly. I still have one brow which is a bit patchy, but it's nothing a bit of powder can't fix. Since finishing chemo I have been taking Biotin daily and a supplement called Hair, Skin and Nails. I don't know if it's helping or not but my hair growth is good. One odd thing is my arm hair. Instead of it lying down against the skin, like it used to, it has grown back but sticks out. I'm thinking of waxing it off and hoping it comes back better. I'm not sure what to do. Also the fur on my face ... blergh! I have also colored mine with a herbal, non paraben, no peroxide, no nasties colour I got at a Health store. It covered the grey stragglers well.

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2011 12:20AM - edited Aug 12, 2011 12:21AM by KiwiMum Hi Ladies.  I've very much enjoyed reading your posts and following your hair growth progress.  It has inspired me to start taking pictures of my journey. I am still having chemo.  I lost my hair a couple of weeks after my first AC - buzzed it once it started coming out in handfuls. I've now completed 5/12 weekly Taxol treatments and my hair is growing back.  It started a couple of weeks ago and I'm completely obssessed with it!  I wonder will it continue to grow?  Will it fall out again?  I'm just happy to think I might have hair for Christmas ... that is my goal. On the rest of my hair.  I have a few lashes on top (not many) and haven't had any lower lashes for a couple of months.  My left brow is hanging in there but the right one is looking odd and missing a chunk in the middle.  Thank goodness for makeup!

Posts.Content: KiwiMum wrote: Hi All In October 2014 I changed from daily Taxmoxifen to daily Examestane (Aromasin) and 4 weekly Zoladex injections as a result of the SOFT study results. I don't like the Zoladex injections - they hurt and I can't be bothered continuing them for years to come.  I've decided to just remove my ovaries and am schedule for a prophylactic double oophorectomy in 4 weeks time. Does anyone have any tips or wisdom they can share?  How was the surgery for you?  What was the recovery like?  Any unexpected side effects? Thanks in advance.  Dx 3/2/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 2, 12/24 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 3/14/2011 Lymph node removal: Right; Mastectomy: Right Chemotherapy 4/19/2011 AC + T (Taxol) Radiation Therapy 10/25/2011 Breast, Lymph nodes Hormonal Therapy 11/1/2011 Surgery 2/1/2013 Reconstruction (right): DIEP flap Surgery 7/1/2013 Reconstruction (right): Nipple reconstruction Hormonal Therapy 10/17/2014 Aromasin (exemestane) Surgery Prophylactic ovary removal Log in to post a reply
